page.title: 13ARCHAEOLOGICAL DIG
page.content: The dig is in the South_west of Ilchester which is an important Roman site.The site was to have a cheese factory on it but it was thought that there was something of importance there,so building was delayed. The dig had four people working on it,one of whom was an archaeologist.On the site there were six large pits which were dug for the gravel for the roads.The pits were then filled with rubbish after the gravel had been taken out.The rubbbish consisted of broken cutlery and then stones and gravel were placed on top.The dig also uncovered some walls which could be the remains of some sort of house or building.Whilst searching for more pits,the dig discovered an Anglo_Saxon path running across all these pits.
